name: Back in Black: Black Adam Quiz / Test | Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What nation has Black Adam ruled for much of his superpowered career?
questions.explanation:
Kahndaq.

	Black Adam rules a Middle Eastern country known as Kahndaq. Latvia is a real country, while Derudi and Jikezstan are not. Needless to say, Kahndaq doesn't exist either.

questions.text: Black Adam does not need to sleep or eat.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Possessing the stamina of Shu, Black Adam does not need to sleep, eat, breathe, drink, and can survive in space without a space suit. This allows him to fight evil twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week!

questions.text: Who removed a malignant tumor in Black Adam's head?
questions.explanation:
Johnny Sorrow.

	In return, Adam joined Johnny Sorrow's Injustice Society. He was a double agent, however, and soon betrayed the Society and helped the Justice Society of America defeat them.

questions.text: Black Adam's first wife was killed by which mad sorceror?
questions.explanation:
Ahk-Ton.

	Black Adam's duties drew him away from his family: his wife Shiruta and children Gon and Hurut. The mad priest Ahk-Ton slew them, only to be killed in return by Adam years later.

questions.text: Black Adam quit the Justice Society of America after they refused to take action against which villain?
questions.explanation:
Kobra.

	Kobra stood trial for killing Atom-Smasher's mother. However, he was acquitted by the legal system and went back to his homeland. He couldn't escape Atom-Smasher and Black Adam, who ripped his heart out.

questions.text: Which Horseman was Isis, Black Adam's second wife, killed by?
questions.explanation:
Pestilence.

	Isis is infected by Pestilence and dies shortly thereafter, but not before saving her husband's life. She dies in Black Adam's arms and begs him to show no mercy to evil.

questions.text: Black Adam killed every single person in which town?
questions.explanation:
Bialya.

	Bialya harbored the Four Horsemen of the Apokolips for a time, the group that killed Black Adam's wife Adrianna and her brother Amon.

questions.text: Black Adam's fingerprints match those of Theo Adam's.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Theo Adam, an unscrupulous man, was the evil side of Black Adam, who killed two people using Black Adam's powers. Black Adam eventually rid himself of Theo Adam, being acquitted of murder when his fingerprints didn't match Theo Adam's.

questions.text: Which Egyptian pharoah did Adam serve?
questions.explanation:
Khufu.

	Osiris is an Egyptian god, and Darius was a Persian ruler who fought against the Persians. Khufu would be reincarnated as Hawkman, who would serve in the Justice Society of America alongside Black Adam.

questions.text: In which city did Black Adam establish an embassy for Kahndaq?
questions.explanation:
New York City.

	These events were depicted in the first issue of DC Comics' limited series "52", part of Black Adam's efforts to use his power to better help his people.
